Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Material: MOTHER OF PEARL; SHELL (OSTRICH EGG); CARNELIAN
Name: Necklace or bracelet
Description: Modern reconstruction of a bracelet(?) from the C-Group period, when the materials were used most often. Nine rectangular mother-of-pearl tablets cut from large Nile shells, pierced at both extremities, separated at the top and at the bottom by nine disc-shaped beads made of ostrich eggshell. A small round bead (diametre 0,35 cm) made of carnelian completes the set.
